body_html:
@pjox That is not the file I meant, I was referring to the file
third_party/gpus/cuda_configure.bzl
in line 722
see here

this solved it for me and i built in on a cluster yesterday. you might have to install bazel in your home directory in case the cluster installation lacks a recent version of it.

body:
@pjox That is not the file I meant, I was referring to the file
`third_party/gpus/cuda_configure.bzl`
in line _722_
see [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/851c28951b7345f303f4ec1d6490e3fadaa0a40e/third_party/gpus/cuda_configure.bzl#L722) 

this solved it for me and i built in on a cluster yesterday. you might have to install bazel in your home directory in case the cluster installation lacks a recent version of it.
